API Endpoints#

Table of Contents

  • Public Endpoints

  • User Endpoints

  • Admin Endpoints

  • Superadmin Endpoints

  • Utility Endpoints

  • Common Error Responses

Public Endpoints#

These endpoints are accessible to all users, including unauthenticated visitors. They support general site functionality such as authentication, viewing legal documents, and accessing publicly available content.

GET /#

Homepage

Status Codes:

  • 200 OK – Rendered homepage

GET /favicon.ico#

Favicon

Status Codes:

  • 200 OK – Returns favicon

GET /contact#

Contact page

Status Codes:

  • 200 OK – Static contact page

GET /faq#

FAQ page

Status Codes:

  • 200 OK – Static FAQ

GET /terms_of_service#

Terms of Service page

Status Codes:

  • 200 OK – Static Terms page

GET /privacy_policy#

Privacy Policy page

Status Codes:

  • 200 OK – Static Privacy Policy

GET /cookie_policy#

Cookie Policy page

Status Codes:

  • 200 OK – Static Cookie Policy

GET /login#

Display the login form.

Status Codes:

  • 200 OK – Login page rendered.

POST /login#

Authenticate a user and start a session.

Status Codes:

  • 302 Found – Redirects to dashboard on success.

  • 400 Bad Request – Invalid credentials.

GET /register#

Display the registration form.

Status Codes:

  • 200 OK – Registration page rendered.

POST /register#

Register a new user.

Status Codes:

  • 302 Found – Redirect on successful registration.

  • 400 Bad Request – Invalid input or user already exists.

User Endpoints#

These endpoints require the user to be authenticated. They allow registered users to perform actions related to their account and event participation, such as viewing available slots, booking events, canceling bookings, and managing passwords.

GET /logout#

Logout the current user.

Status Codes:

  • 302 Found – Redirected after logout.

GET /events#

View events and booking slots.

Status Codes:

  • 200 OK – Event calendar data returned.

POST /events#

Create a new event.

Status Codes:

  • 201 Created – Event created.

  • 400 Bad Request – Invalid input.

POST /booking#

Book a slot for an event.

Status Codes:

  • 200 OK – Booking confirmed.

  • 400 Bad Request – Slot unavailable or invalid input.

POST /cancel_booking/{slot_id}#

Cancel an existing booking.

Parameters:

  • slot_id (string)

Status Codes:

  • 200 OK – Booking cancelled.

  • 404 Not Found – Slot not found.

GET /change_password#

Show the change password form.

Status Codes:

  • 200 OK – Change password form.

POST /change_password#

Update user password.

Status Codes:

  • 200 OK – Password changed successfully.

  • 400 Bad Request – Validation error or incorrect password.

Admin Endpoints#

Accessible only by authenticated admin users, these endpoints provide administrative control over application configuration, event validation, weather updates, and user management tasks such as role assignment and user blocking.

POST /admin/config#

Update system configuration.

Status Codes:

  • 200 OK – Configuration updated.

  • 400 Bad Request – Invalid config parameters.

POST /admin/user/block#

Block or unblock a user.

Status Codes:

  • 200 OK – User updated.

  • 403 Forbidden – Not allowed.

POST /admin/user/role#

Change a user’s role.

Status Codes:

  • 200 OK – Role updated.

  • 403 Forbidden – Forbidden.

POST /admin/confirm_event#

Confirm a scheduled event.

Status Codes:

  • 200 OK – Event confirmed.

  • 404 Not Found – Event not found.

GET /admin/update_events_weather#

Refresh weather data for all events.

Status Codes:

  • 200 OK – Weather data updated.

POST /admin/delete_event/{event_id}#

Delete a scheduled event.

Parameters:

  • event_id (string)

Status Codes:

  • 200 OK – Event deleted.

  • 404 Not Found – Event not found.

Superadmin Endpoints#

Reserved for superadministrators, these endpoints enable the execution of critical account management actions such as permanent user deletion. They should be protected with strict access controls and auditing.

POST /admin/user/delete#

Delete a user account.

Status Codes:

  • 200 OK – User account deleted.

  • 403 Forbidden – Forbidden. Only superadmins allowed.

  • 500 Internal Server Error – Deletion error.

Utility Endpoints#

These endpoints serve JavaScript assets that enhance frontend interactivity for authenticated users. Though technically public, they are primarily intended to support functionality on protected pages.

GET /js/events.js#

Serve events.js static script

Status Codes:

  • 200 OK – JavaScript file served successfully.

  • 404 Not Found – File not found.

GET /js/change_password.js#

Serve change_password.js static script

Status Codes:

  • 200 OK – JavaScript file served successfully.

  • 404 Not Found – File not found.

GET /js/admin.js#

Serve admin.js static script

Status Codes:

  • 200 OK – JavaScript file served successfully.

  • 404 Not Found – File not found.

GET /js/user_accounts.js#

Serve user_accounts.js static script

Status Codes:

  • 200 OK – JavaScript file served successfully.

  • 404 Not Found – File not found.

GET /js/events_calendar.js#

Serve events_calendar.js static script

Status Codes:

  • 200 OK – JavaScript file served successfully.

  • 404 Not Found – File not found.

Common Error Responses#

These reusable response descriptions are used across multiple endpoints.

Component Name

Description

NotFound

Resource not found (custom 404 page).

Forbidden

Access denied (custom 403 page).

InternalServerError

Unexpected server error (custom 500 page).
